intro: Silene schizolepis, commonly known as the split-leaved catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, pinkish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are divided into narrow, thread-like segments, giving it its common name. Silene schizolepis is an herbaceous perennial that blooms in late spring to early summer.
